title: nf-mirna pipeline parameters
description: Small RNA-Seq Best Practice Analysis Pipeline.

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row. See [usage docs](https://nf-co.re/smrnaseq/usage#samplesheet-input).

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

save_intermediates.description: Save all intermediate files (e.g. fastq, bams) of all steps of the pipeline  to output directory

mirtrace_options.title: miRTrace QC options
mirtrace_options.description: Switches to skip specific pipeline steps, if desired.

mirtrace_protocol.description: Protocol to use for miRTrace QC.
mirtrace_protocol.help_text: One of the following (read structure schematic in parens): illumina (miRNA--3'-adapter--index), nextflex (NNNN--miRNA--NNNN--3'-adapter--index).

mirtrace_species.description: Species to use for miRTrace QC, see `mirtrace --list-species` for available options.

three_prime_adapter.description: 3' adapter sequence to use for miRTrace QC.
three_prime_adapter.help_text: The 3' adapter sequence to use for miRTrace QC. Defaults to the Illumina TruSeq Small RNA 3' adapter sequence.

alignment_options.title: Alignment options (mature and genomic)
alignment_options.description: Options for aligning reads to the genome and mature miRNAs.

mature.description: Path to FASTA file with mature miRNAs.
mature.help_text:
Typically this will be the `mature.fa` file from miRBase. Can be given either as a plain text `.fa` file or a compressed `.gz` file.

Defaults to the current miRBase release URL, from which the file will be downloaded.

hairpin.description: Path to FASTA file with miRNAs precursors.
hairpin.help_text:
Typically this will be the `mature.fa` file from miRBase. Can be given either as a plain text `.fa` file or a compressed `.gz` file.

Defaults to the current miRBase release URL, from which the file will be downloaded.

mirna_gtf.description: Path to GTF file with miRNA genomic coordinates.

genome_index.description: Path to the genome bowtie index.
genome_index.help_text: Path to the genome index. This should either be a directory containing the genome index files generated by `bowtie-build` or its `.tar.gz` compressed version.

genome.description: Path to the genome FASTA file. Will be used to create a genome index if none is provided and to run the miRDeep2 module.
genome.help_text: Path to the genome FASTA file. If a genome index is not provided, an index will be generated using this file. If both a genomic index and a FASTA are provided, pipeline will fail if the genome index was not created using the same FASTA genomic file.

skipping_pipeline_steps.title: Skipping pipeline steps
skipping_pipeline_steps.description: Switches to skip specific pipeline steps, if desired.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime
